info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 24 at 4:40AM CST by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
At 439 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Haslet to 7 miles southwest of Benbrook. Movement was east at 50 mph.
HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fort Worth, Flower Mound, Haltom City, Keller, Southlake, Watauga, Benbrook, Saginaw, White Settlement, and Crowley around 445 AM CST. Bedford, Grapevine, Hurst, Colleyville, Forest Hill, Richland Hills, and Everman around 450 AM CST. Arlington, Lewisville, Euless, Coppell, Kennedale, Rendon, and DFW Intl Airport around 455 AM CST. Dallas, Irving, Carrollton, and Pantego around 500 AM CST. Plano, Grand Prairie, The Colony, Farmers Branch, and Hebron around 505 AM CST. Addison around 510 AM CST. Dallas Love Field around 515 AM CST. Duncanville and Cockrell Hill around 520 AM CST.
Other locations impacted by these storms include Westlake, Benbrook Lake, Lake Arlington, Westover Hills, Joe Pool Lake, Mountain Creek Lake, Marshall Creek, Grapevine Lake, Dalworthington Gardens, and Lake Worth.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 35W between mile markers 38 and 70. Interstate 35E between mile markers 433 and 451. Interstate 20 between mile markers 426 and 463. Interstate 30 between mile markers 6 and 41.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

parameter.value: Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Denton, Tarrant and western Dallas Counties through 530 AM CST
